headline: Flow profiling. Saturated group. Full control.
subheadline: Dual stainless boilers, a rotary pump with integrated flow control, shot timer, and pressure gauge -- the Studio is a prosumer machine built for baristas who want to manipulate every variable.
hero_image_alt: Arco Studio espresso machine with walnut accents, flow control paddle mid-adjustment during extraction, pressure gauge reading 6 bar during a declining pressure profile, precision scale beneath the cup showing real-time weight
description_long: The Studio is where Arco stops holding your hand. The saturated 58mm group head delivers thermal stability measured in tenths of a degree. The rotary pump feeds through an integrated flow control valve that lets you manipulate flow rate in real time -- ramp pre-infusion, hold pressure, decline through the tail of the shot. Dual stainless steel boilers (300ml brew, 500ml steam) are independently PID-controlled, and the built-in shot timer syncs with the pump so you're never guessing. The 3-litre tank supports reservoir operation or direct plumbing for zero-interruption workflows. At 18 kg, it's substantial enough for thermal mass, compact enough for a home counter. This is the machine you buy when you've stopped asking how to make espresso and started asking what espresso can become.
use_case_headline: For the barista who profiles, not just pulls.
use_case_body: Real-time flow control. Saturated group for thermal precision. Dual PID with 0.1-degree resolution. Integrated shot timer. Plumb-in capable. The Studio gives you every lever -- literally and figuratively -- to chase the shot you've been imagining.

social_proof_quote.quote: The flow control on the Studio is exceptional. I'm running declining pressure profiles on light roasts that I couldn't achieve on my previous Decent. The saturated group holds temperature like nothing I've used at home. This is a serious machine.
social_proof_quote.name: Hiroshi T.
